result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney Alan Sutton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rodney Alan Sutton in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts,  joint recommendation DEF pleads NC to CT#2 Found guilty, CT#1 dismissed and read-in.
Court sentences DEF on CT#2 to fine $100/costs  total $579.00

Defendant Rodney Alan Sutton in court.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEF thought his counsel was Martin Jarvis, PD appointment shows James McLaughlin - neither counsel appeared, Generate Notice to counsel.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.

APPEARANCES: Defendant Rodney Alan Sutton in court with Attorney Martin Jarvis.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint.  Court enters NOT GUILTY plea to Counts 1 and 2 on behalf of DE.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
